section.title: API Verification
section.para: &kw-hos-phrase; provides a tool, Tempest, that you can use to verify that your cloud deployment completed successfully:
The verification tests rely on you having an external network setup and a cloud image in your image (Glance) repository. Run the following playbook to configure your cloud:

Tempest is a set of integration tests for OpenStack API validation, scenarios, and other specific tests to be run against a live OpenStack cluster.
In &kw-hos-phrase;, Tempest has been modelled as a service and this gives you the ability to locate Tempest anywhere in the cloud. It is recommended that you install Tempest on your lifecycle manager node - that is where it resides by default in a new installation.

A version of the upstream Tempest integration tests is pre-deployed on the &kw-hos; lifecycle manager node. For details on what Tempest is testing, you can check the contents of this file on your lifecycle manager:
You can use these embedded tests to verify if the deployed cloud is functional.
For more information on running Tempest tests, see Tempest - The OpenStack Integration Test Suite.

important.para: Running these tests requires access to the deployed cloud's identity admin credentials

section.para: Tempest creates and deletes test accounts and test resources for test purposes.
In certain cases Tempest might fail to clean-up some of test resources after a test is complete, for example in case of failed tests.

section.bridgehead: Run Tests for Specific Services and Exclude Specific Features
section.para: Tempest allows you to test specific services and features using the tempest.conf configuration file.
A working configuration file with inline documentation is deployed under /opt/stack/tempest/etc/.
To use this, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Log in to the lifecycle manager.
To test specific service, edit the [service_available] section and clear the comment character # and set a line to true to test that service or false to not test that service.
To test specific features, edit any of the *_feature_enabled sections to enable or disable tests on specific features of a service.
listitem.screen: #Is the v2 identity API enabled (boolean value) api_v2 = true #Is the v3 identity API enabled (boolean value) api_v3 = false

section.bridgehead: Run Tests Matching a Series of White and Blacklists
section.para: You can run tests against specific scenarios by editing or creating a run filter file.
Run filter files are deployed under /opt/stack/tempest/run_filters.
Use run filters to whitelist or blacklist specific tests or groups of tests:

listitem.para: lines starting with # or empty are ignored
lines not matching any of the above conditions are blacklisted

section.para: If whitelist is empty, all available tests are fed to blacklist. If blacklist is empty, all tests from whitelist are returned.
Whitelist is applied first. The blacklist is executed against the set of tests returned by the whitelist.
